learning_outcomes.description: Define, and describe in terms of everyday phenomena, conservation of mass, conservation of energy (1st law of thermodynamics), and the 2nd law of thermodynamics.
Define, and describe the physical basis, of the thermodynamic properties (e.g. internal energy, enthalpy, entropy etc.) and thermodynamic functions (e.g. heat and work).
Calculate thermodynamic properties using property tables, property diagrams, the ideal gas equation, and heat capacities.
Translate descriptions, and diagrams, of processes into relevant system boundaries, flows, and assumptions for use in thermodynamic modelling and analysis.
Apply the conservation of mass, the conservation of energy (1st law of thermodynamics), and the 2nd law of thermodynamics to solve problems for well-defined systems without reactions.
Analyse multi-unit systems, predominantly refrigeration and power cycles, using the 1st and 2nd laws of thermodynamics.
Explain the links between energy systems and sustainability and analyse energy systems using thermodynamics and sustainability measures.

assessments.task_description:
• Homework and tutorial exercises. The questions are available on Blackboard.
  • Your best 10 submissions (of 11) will count to the 30% total. 
  • Exercises are due each week (from week 2 onwards). Weeks where no submission is required will be flagged on Blackboard.
  • Tutorials must be submitted by 4pm Monday* after your tutorial via Gradescope as a single PDF. (*or 24hr later if Monday is a public holiday)
  • The PDF must be clear and legible. Use a PDF scanning app on your phone. If you don't have a suitable phone, you can scan to PDF in the library. Do NOT take photos and paste into a word document. 
  • These can be submitted in pairs (must be in the same tutor group) or individually. If you submit as a pair, both students' details must be added to the Group Details on Gradescope (see detailed instructions on Blackboard). Only one of the pair needs to submit online. The other student will receive the same mark as long as their name in on the submission. 
  • You are encouraged to attend and complete all submissible questions during the tutorial, when help is at hand, and get on with the other things in your life!

This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI and MT tools.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Submitted via Gradescope as a single PDF. The PDF must be clear and legible. Use a PDF scanning app on your phone or a scanner to create the PDF.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: Late Penalty without an approved extension - 10% penalty per day up to 2 calendar days. After 2 calendar days submissions will receive 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.due_date:
15/09/2025 - 17/09/2025

  • Exam opens from Mon 09:00 to Wed 16:00
  • You have 110 mins (90 mins writing plus 20 mins for scanning and uploading)
assessments.task_description:
• In-Semester Exam completed online in week 8 (between Mon - Wed Sep 15 to 17).
  • You have 110 mins (90 mins writing plus 20 mins for scanning and uploading) to complete exam and submit your answers, once you open the exam.
  • Covers Weeks 1 to 6. All outcomes from those weeks can be tested. 
  • The exam will be online.
  • Working / communicating with other people during the exam is not permitted at all and will be treated as serious student misconduct. 
  • Further details about doing the exam will be confirmed on Blackboard. 
  • This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance. A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct. To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI and MT tools.
assessments.submission_guidelines: More information on submission will be given on Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: Exams submitted after the end of the submission time will incur a late penalty.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description:
Small project report considering the energy flows and sustainability of the UQ AEB building. 

The report will include two parts (a) a plant visit workbook (describing the plant visit), worth 5% and (b) an analysis of energy flows and sustainability impacts of the AEB energy usage under different scenarios, worth 15%. Both reports are individual submissions.

This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI and MT tools.

More details are provided on Blackboard.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Closed book and invigilated examination. 

Student receive the equation and data booklet in the exam paper.

Casio FX82 series or UQ approved and labelled calculator ONLY can be used in all exams for this course.

This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT). Students are advised that the use of AI or MT technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.topic:
Learn X: Module Videos,notes,and self-quizzes

LearnX modules will be set before the workshop each week. Each module consists of videos, notes, and self-check quizzes to get you started on that week. These modules are supplemented by the text book to give further details on areas of confusion.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05, L06, L07

learning_activities.topic:
AEB energy system bldg visit and sustainability assessment

Visit to AEB bldg energy system, in groups of 20. Site visit worksheet to be completed and submitted along with sustainability assessments, as part of the case study.

Learning outcomes: L04, L05, L06, L07
